result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No contact with Tracy Brown, no consumption of alcohol and take all prescribed medications in the manner in which they are prescribed.

2:32 PM Defendant Joshua Lee Fox in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Joshua Lee Fox.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. State - here for PH. Halyburton interrupts Court, needs to meet with her client. Court will allow, recess at 2:35 PM. Recalled at 2:44 PM with same appearances. Halyburton thanks Court for allowing her time to meet with her client, states concerns as it relates to competency. Fox interrupts. Halyburton continues, believes Fox would like to fire her and makes statements as it relates to that. Court denies the request for withdrawal at this time unless Fox hires someone else, ordering competency exam, outpatient, verifies address and phone number, warns of not participating in the mental evaluation, continues bond, asks if defendant is supposed to take any medications. Fox responds. Court will modify bond, keep at $750.00 cash, no contact with Tracy Brown, no consumption of alcohol and take all prescribed medications in the manner in which they are prescribed. Court will set for a competency hearing on 12/5/22 at 10:00 AM.
Competency hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Competency hearing on December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Prior: 3348 Indian Rt 10, Crandon, WI 54520

9:21 AM Defendant Joshua Lee Fox in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Joshua Lee Fox.  Attorney Charles James Simono in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Halyburton has went over complaint, waives further reading, asks for matter to be set for PH within time limits. Court has set for PH and continues bond.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:30 AM Defendant Joshua Lee Fox not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. State asks for forfeiture of bond posted. Court reviews file, defendant was in Court via video last time and was given today's date, forfeits bond posted, issues bench warrant, body or $800.00. Court recalls case at 10:39 AM and now appears with Attorney Halyburton. Court will quash the warrant on this matter as defendant may have been in the hallway talking to Ms. Halyburton. Halyburton asks for one more adjournment of the AIA for stated reasons. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 10/12/22 at 9:15 AM, reinstates bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Joshua Lee Fox appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Halyburton appears in person. Halyburton has not went over the complaint, unable to opt in yet and asks for AIA. Court reads charges and penalties. Fox understands. Halyburton asks for reduction of bond. State asks that bond remain for reasons as stated on the record. Court continues bond at this point and has set for AIA.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
